charter.title: Civic AI Charter
charter.purpose: Tie every AI deployment to human flourishing metrics: jobs sustained, education and health access, emissions avoided. Based on UNESCO Recommendation on the Ethics of AI, adapted locally with citizen participation.

pillars.title: Representation
pillars.desc: Delegate graph, participation quotas, recall tooling, sortition-based assemblies
principles: One person, one voice — weighted by nothing except residency
Randomly stratified assemblies mirror local demographics
Recall mechanisms for any delegate within 90 days
Progressive disclosure: simple ballots for routine, deep packets for complex

pillars.title: Finance
pillars.desc: Treasury accounting, programmatic disbursements, on-chain attestations
principles: All flows auditable in real-time via public ledger
Escrow two years of Civic Dividend payouts as stability reserve
Mission Investment Syndicate with impact covenants

pillars.title: Transparency
pillars.desc: Bias tests, red-team exercises, incident reports, public dashboards
principles: Every high-risk AI system gets participatory safety review before deployment
Quarterly AI + Climate Impact hearings with public testimony
Threshold breaches trigger automatic policy reviews
All audit data feeds public dashboards within 48 hours

charter.enforcement: Citizen assemblies issue go/no-go recommendations that procurement must honor. Legal teams convert outputs into ordinances within 45 days. Majority and minority reports published.

modules.title: Representation Module
modules.desc: Delegate graph with sortition engine, participation quotas, recall tooling, and progressive ballot disclosure.
features: Sortition engine — cryptographically random, demographically stratified
Delegate graph — tracks chains of delegation and recall history
Participation quotas — ensures minimum representation from underrepresented groups
Ballot engine — ranked choice, quadratic, and approval voting modes
Accessibility — screen reader, large print, multi-language, IVR phone voting
modules.techStack: Go/Rust backend, Next.js frontend, W3C DID identity

modules.title: Finance Module
modules.desc: Treasury accounting with real-time public ledger, programmatic disbursements, impact attestations, and escrow management.
features: Real-time treasury dashboard — all inflows/outflows visible
Programmatic disbursement engine — rules-based payments, no discretionary gates
On-chain attestation — proof of disbursement for audit trails
Escrow management — 24-month Civic Dividend reserve
Mission Investment Syndicate portal — deal room, due diligence, impact tracking
modules.techStack: Rust smart contracts, PostgreSQL, Kafka event stream

modules.title: Transparency Module
modules.desc: AI audit pipeline with bias testing, red-team exercises, incident reporting, and auto-published public dashboards.
features: Bias test suite — demographic parity, equalized odds, calibration metrics
Red-team scheduler — automated + manual adversarial testing
Incident report pipeline — intake, triage, root cause, remediation tracking
Public dashboard auto-publish — all audit data within 48 hours
Threshold alerts — automatic policy review triggers on metric breaches
modules.techStack: Python ML pipeline, DuckDB analytics, Next.js dashboards, SOC 2 controls

modules.title: Identity Module
modules.desc: W3C DID-based civic identity for residency proof without leaking personal information. Progressive disclosure of attributes.
features: Zero-knowledge residency proof
Selective attribute disclosure
Cross-region credential portability
Biometric fallback (optional, consent-gated)
Offline verification via QR + NFC
modules.techStack: W3C DID, Verifiable Credentials, Rust verifier

modules.title: Measurement Module
modules.desc: Unified instrumentation pipeline tracking AI safety incidents, job transitions, emissions avoided, habitats restored.
features: Kafka/Snowplow event collection
DuckDB + Iceberg analytical tables
Auto-generated weekly public briefs
Rolling 90-day impact reports
Quarterly hearing data packages
